definition: to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: The visa application charge will be returned to the applicant, care of the migration agent's address.
sentences.chinese: 簽證申請費將會經由移民代理的地址轉交退給申請人。

sentences.english: Warwick presents Plantagenet's request to have his father's title passed on to him.
sentences.chinese: 華威介紹普朗塔的要求，有他父親的所有權轉交給他。

sentences.english: The building will devolve to his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 這座大樓將轉交給其長子。

sentences.english: David Smith, care of Mary Jones, 16, High Street.
sentences.chinese: 高街16號瑪麗瓊斯轉交戴維史密斯。

sentences.english: You letter of 15th August addressed to our Head Office has been passed on to us for attention and reply.
sentences.chinese: 您八月十五日致我總公司的信函已轉交到我處作復。

sentences.english: If the House votes for impeachment, the case then goes to the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 彈劾案在衆議院通過後即轉交參議院審理。

sentences.english: The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 那交給你轉交給別人的厚禮？

sentences.english: I agree that the above data will be released to the manager of the church and the church.
sentences.chinese: 本人同意上述個人資料會轉交予經理及教堂。

sentences.english: Few believe the military will really hand over power to a civilian government.
sentences.chinese: 很少有人認爲軍方會真正將權力轉交給一個平民政府。

sentences.english: Dai Bingguo forwarded a letter for President Chirac by President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉國轉交了胡錦濤主席致希拉剋總統的信。

sentences.english: Venne presented gifts to Obama for his children and wife.
sentences.chinese: 維尼請他轉交禮物給歐巴馬的太太與小孩。

sentences.english: What spending and taxing powers are European citizens - who will have to be consulted - willing to transfer to "Brussels"?
sentences.chinese: 歐洲公民願意將何種支出和稅收權轉交給歐盟呢？

sentences.english: The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 慷慨的賞賜，卻不予轉交？

sentences.english: Supply Chain Quality Department will then direct questions to the appropriate department.
sentences.chinese: 供應鏈質量部會將該問題轉交給相關部門。

sentences.english: When you write to me from Kweilin, please address letter in care of my office above - Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 從桂林給我寫信時，請寄我的辦公室轉交。

sentences.english: I would stick with A Sand County Almanac, and pass on Hands-On Environmentalism.
sentences.chinese: 我將繼續支持一本沙縣年鑑，並且轉交實踐的環境論。

definition: to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
to follow/to follow up
email/abbr. for 電子郵件|电子邮件[dian4 zi3 you2 jian4]
prosecutor's office/procuratorate
to refer sb to an agency (or hospital etc)/referral
to verify/to check
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to return sth/to revert
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to request/to ask/request/CL:個|个[ge4]
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to examine/to investigate/to censor out/censorship
to contribute (as a gift)/to donate/benefaction
staff/crew/personnel/CL:個|个[ge4]
investigate/check out (a story)
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
